content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the function to clean a column name in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    col = lowercase(col)
    col = strip(col)
    col = replace(col, " " => "_")
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_")
    return col
end
```

To break this down:

- `lowercase(col)` converts the column name to all lowercase letters
- `strip(col)` removes any leading or trailing whitespace 
- `replace(col, " " => "_")` replaces any spaces with underscores
- `replace(col, "-" => "_")` replaces any hyphens with underscores

So if you passed in `"My Column"`, it would convert it to `"my_column"`.

Some examples of using this:

```julia
clean_column("My Column") # "my_column"
clean_column("my column") # "my_column" 
clean_column("My-Column") # "my_column"
```

Let me know if you have any other questions!
